European Master of Science in Sustainable Food Systems Engineering, Technology and Business

BiFTec-FOOD4S

European Master of Sustainable Food Systems Engineering, Technology and Business https://iiw.kuleuven.be/english/food4s https://iiw.kuleuven.be/++resource++plone-logo.svg

Aim of the programme

Looking for a Master's programme to foster innovation and technology in order to cope with the future needs and sustainability in food systems, technology and business? You are welcome to join our European MSc programme!

To foster innovation and technology to cope with future needs and sustainability within our FOOD4S ( "food force" ) paradigm: S ustainable Food S ystem S S cience and Engineering.

BiFTec-FOOD4S adopts a transversal and multidisciplinary approach to a broad range of topics related to the 4S pillars Science (Food Science & Engineering Technology), Sustainability (Sustainable Food Product & Food Process Design), Safety (Food Safety & Quality), and Simulation (Computational Food Science & Technology).

A joint degree

The Consortium of the four European partner universities jointly have committed themselves to each offering part of the curriculum. Successful graduates are awarded a joint degree.

Admission requirements and application

Admission requirements

  • More information on admission requirements

Application

To apply nowÂ for the BiFTec-FOOD4S programme in the Application Tool please select:

  • Type of programme: Master's programme in English (diploma contract)
  • Academic year: 2025-2026
  • Programme: European Master in Sustainable Food Systems Engineering, Technology and Business (Ghent et al)

Application form

Apply now for the European Master in Sustainable Food Systems Engineering, Technology and Business (BiFTec-FOOD4S) !

Application deadlines

  • 1 st of March: AllÂ nationals applyingÂ for admission and consortium scholarship *
  • 1 st of June:Â all nationals on self-paying basis (admission only)

    * Your application is automatically considered for the consortium scholarship if application and all required supporting documents have been uploaded by the deadline of 1st of March

Associated partners

AdditionalÂ to the four European consortium partners, the study programme also benefits from the involvement of associated partners, who contribute through knowledge and skills transfer, the provisions and backing possibilities for (optional) professional competence module and/or Master's thesis.

The associated partners include:

  • French National Research Institute for Agriculture,Â FoodÂ and Environment - INRAE, France
  • University ofÂ Tasmania, Australia
  • University of Campinas UNICAMP, Brazil
  • Nofima -Â food research institute in fisheries and aquaculture, Norway
  • Queen's University of Belfast, UK
  • CLUN, United Dairy Cooperatives, Spain
  • University of Zagreb, Croatia

Structure

As of 2020-2021 the Master's programme consists of 90 ECTS taught modules and 30 ECTS Master's thesis project. Summer Professional Competence module is optional.

The Master's programmeÂ is organised in a modular format:

  • Full-time format
  • Individual modules
  • Timetable of the curriculum

Career prospects

The European Master of Science in Sustainable Food Systems Engineering, Technology and Business (BiFTec-FOOD4S) general course aims are targeting on preparing competent employees for sectors including sustainable food production, processing and agribusiness, in industry, academia and government.

Approximately 90% of the graduates of the precedingÂ SEFOTECH.NUT course run from 2006 till 2016 and BiFTeC course (2015-2020) are getting full employment resulting from an ample number of job applications and within a reasonable application time of six months.Â The academic level of the Masterâs course is being proved by the ability of approximately 10% of graduates who continue their studies at third level making a PhD.

Information relating to individuals (personal data) is collected and used in accordance with the Regulation (EC) No 45/2001 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 18 December 2000 on the protection of individuals with regard to the processing of personal data by the Community institutions and bodies and on the free movement of such data, OJ L8 of 12.1.2001, p. 1.

The development of a joint curriculum for BIFTEC-FOOD4S programme took place during implementation of the previous projects: European Master of Food Science, Technology and Nutrition (SEFOTECH.NUT)
and European Master of Food Science, Technology and Business (BiFTec) run under Erasmus Mundus framework:Â 2005-2011, 2010-2016, and 2015-2020.

Structure The programme will be offered in a full-time format over two academic years. Studying individual modules may be possible as well. https://iiw.kuleuven.be/english/food4s/structure https://iiw.kuleuven.be/++resource++plone-logo.svg

Structure

The programme will be offered in a full-time format over two academic years. Studying individual modules may be possible as well.

Full-time format

The programme is offered in modules based on lectures, tutorials, workshops, seminars, site visits and student-directed learning. Each of the taught modules (core and optional) is offered over a two-Â three- to four-week timeframe with assessment scheduled on the completion of each module.

Subjects are developed to master level and reinforce the capacity to survey, critically evaluate and interpret the scientific literature, integrate basic and applied science and encourage the expression of independent opinion and critique in course assignments.

Seminars

In theÂ seminars , advanced-level and professionally relevant topics are debated based on academic and practical experience. In order to prepare you to undertake the project/thesis, course work in biostatistics, information technology, research methodology and project preparation guidance are provided. You will be made aware of best practices and the legislative framework relating to all aspects of food production, processing, marketing, business and distribution.

Master's thesis project

The Master's thesisÂ project will be organised during the second year. You will be involved inÂ selecting your projectÂ based on your choiceÂ of optional modules and career aspirations. Option to undertake aÂ summerÂ professional competency module in a company setting will additionally contribute to the development of the professional skills and experience.

Individual modules

Qualified candidates may study individual modules and accumulate credits over a timeframe planned together with the Programme Director and approved by the Joint Management Board . Individual modules may be taken as part of an approved industrial Continuous Professional Programme (CPD).

Timetable

You can find the timetable here.

Information relating to individuals (personal data) is collected and used in accordance with the Regulation (EC) No 45/2001 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 18 December 2000 on the protection of individuals with regard to the processing of personal data by the Community institutions and bodies and on the free movement of such data, OJ L8 of 12.1.2001, p. 1.

The development of a joint curriculum for BIFTEC-FOOD4S programme took place during implementation of the previous projects: European Master of Food Science, Technology and Nutrition (SEFOTECH.NUT)
and European Master of Food Science, Technology and Business (BiFTec) run under Erasmus Mundus framework:Â 2005-2011, 2010-2016, and 2015-2020.

Application and admission

For whom?

  • Non-EU graduates as well as EU graduates intending to follow or develop their careers in food science, technology and business.
  • Certain modules will also be available to qualified persons in the workplace, who wish to gain new insights and knowledge.

Admission requirements

  • A Bachelor of Science degree in a relevant area of studies giving access to a Master degree programme.
  • Evidence of English proficiency. All applicants who have not obtained a previous diploma in a programme taught in English in Australia, English-speaking Canada, Ireland, New Zealand, the United Kingdom and the United States of America must submit a certificate proving their proficiency in Englishââââ.Â The English proficiency test scores accepted by KU Leuven are the TOEFL iBT certificate, IELTS Academic certificate, Cambridge C1 Advanced (CAE) or C2 Proficiency (CPE) certificate. E.g., TOEFLÂ iBT 90 with a score of at least 20 in each section; or IELTS score 6.5 with no sub-score below 6.0; orÂ CAEÂ or CPE: 176+ on Cambridge English scale with no less than 169 in each skill and use of English.

International admission

More about the international admissions at the KU Leuven .

APPLICATION DEADLINES

  • 1 st of March: AllÂ nationals applyingÂ for programme admission with consortiumÂ scholarship *
  • 1 st of June: AllÂ nationals on self-paying basis (admission only)

    * Your application is automatically considered for the consortium scholarship if application and all required supporting documents have been uploaded by the deadline of 1st of March (unless you differently specify in your application form)

APPLICATION DOCUMENTS

Application procedure includes proper submission of the Core documents andÂ Additional documents:

  • At least two recommendation letters are requested (at least one of the referees shouldÂ come from the university of origin). The recommendation letters should not be uploaded via the web application but sent directly by the referee to the programme email address . You can download the template for the recommendation letterÂ here or use another free format where the aspects specified in the template are covered.

AFTER THE SELECTION AND ADMISSION

Beginning of May: All candidates are notified of the official decision of the FOOD4S admission board by email. The communication includes decision regarding the admission to the programme and potential scholarship award. All admitted applicants are sent an admission letter. Candidates awarded the consortium scholarship obtain also a Scholarship letter.

1st of June onwards : Non-EEA citizens should apply for long stay visa for Belgium (visa type D, code B35 -Â mobility programme).
For more information on visa and visa application procedure click here .

APPEAL PROCEDURE

If a candidate believes that the selection committee has not considered the application in a fair way, according to the selection process, may submit an appeal. The appeal cannot concern the decision itself but only an alleged error made in the process.

If an applicant believes there are grounds for contesting the selection result and wishes to appeal the decision of the scholarship selection committee must do so in writing, by an email directed to programme office, within 7 working daysÂ  from the date of the official notification. The email subject heading should include the words âFOOD4S scholarship appeal,â together with the full name of the applicant. In the email body the reasons for the appeal and all the relevant elements to support it shall be stated. Please note, that no additional information other than what was submitted with the application, can be considered in the appeal procedure (e.g., further education, experiences, additional certificates or documents,â¦). Generic statements about the quality of the submitted application will not be accepted as the evaluation process is not only done on absolute quality but considers relative position among all other eligible applications.
The FOOD4S office is committed to answer the appeal within two weeks (14 days).

PRACTICAL INFORMATION FOR ADMITTED STUDENTS

  • More information on KU Leuven - Ghent Campus - first host institution

Get to Ghent

Brussels National Airport is situated in Zaventem, between Leuven and Brussels.

The railway station is located in the underground (level -1) of the airport terminal building. There is a direct link from Brussels Airport to Gent Sint-Pieters station with approximate journey time of 1 hour. Schedule information for the airport city express and the whole of Belgium (and international trains) is available on the Belgian Railways (SNCB/NMBS) website.

Welcome desk @ Brussels Airport

Look out for the KU Leuven welcome desk in the arrivals hall at Brussels Airport on your right hand side, after you have gone through the bagage reclaim hall. The welcome desk will help you travel on to your campus. Open every day from 11th Sept to 22nd Sept between 7am and 9pm .

STUDENT SUPPORT

The consortium opts for a structured offer of study and student guidance at each consortium university, supplemented with student support on demand.Â Â Regardless in which phase of the programme the student is and with which partner institution, students are free to ask lecturers and assistants questions about subject matter. Personal assistance by the lecturer is also possible during contact hours thanks to the small group sizes for practical sessions.
The participating universities are aware of the cultural differences and the difficulties in hosting this particular and diverse target group. As a result, they have mechanisms in place for housing, visa application, coaching, counseling and study advice, social integration and support, etc. The consortium is also conscious of the importance of good working administrative systems, communication processes and welfare services for the quality of an international studentâs experience. Therefore, the FOOD4S consortium and course organization pay particular attention to the following aspects:
- typically provided by the coordinating institute: thorough pre-arrival information, e.g., availability of an international student guide, clear communication channels, help with visa/legal issues, official welcome event, orientation days, health insurance contracts, etc.
- provided by all hosting institutes: official welcome event, help with finding accommodation, language courses, student associations, health and social care systems, counselors for special needs students, extra-curricular/leisure activities, etc.

All consortium partners have appointed an International Office, an international coordinator and studentsâ service departments which provide support in registration, study confirmation letters and other student issues and procedures.
Each partner university provides student support on topics such as failure anxiety and study planning, in collaboration with the student support and social services on campus. Students with a disability can contact the campus care coordinator.
Finally, for issues relating to teaching or examinations, students can seek help from an ombudsperson.

SCHOLARSHIPS

The programme has been co-funded by the European Commission within the frameworkÂ  of the Erasmus+ Programme of the European Union. Erasmus Mundus scholarships have been awarded to top ranked students and scholars for the intakes comencing in 2021 up to 2024.

New application round for students to commence the studies in September 2025 (Cohort 2025-2027) is now open. For the intake 2025, no Erasmus Mundus scholarships are available, although the programme remains in the Erasmus Mundus catalogue at least for the next 3 editions.

From intake 2025 on, the partner universities will award internal consortium scholarships .

IndicativeÂ number of student scholarships

This corresponds to 1,000 euro per month of studies as monthly living allowance for a maximum of 24 months. The students awarded with this scholarship will still be required to pay the enrolment fee as per their nationality category (Programme Country or Partner Country).

CAREER PATHS

The programme prepares students for industry sectors including food production, processing and agribusiness as well as for research. Graduates are qualified to fill a wide variety of positions, ranging from market researcher over product analyst and product developer up to food broker in a variety of venues, including private industry, commercial farms and ranches, government agencies, production agriculture, and academia. On average 15% of graduates commenceÂ PhD studies.

Structure The programme will be offered in a full-time format over two academic years. Studying individual modules may be possible as well. https://iiw.kuleuven.be/english/food4s/structure https://iiw.kuleuven.be/++resource++plone-logo.svg

Structure

The programme will be offered in a full-time format over two academic years. Studying individual modules may be possible as well.

Full-time format

The programme is offered in modules based on lectures, tutorials, workshops, seminars, site visits and student-directed learning. Each of the taught modules (core and optional) is offered over a two-Â three- to four-week timeframe with assessment scheduled on the completion of each module.

Subjects are developed to master level and reinforce the capacity to survey, critically evaluate and interpret the scientific literature, integrate basic and applied science and encourage the expression of independent opinion and critique in course assignments.

Seminars

In theÂ seminars , advanced-level and professionally relevant topics are debated based on academic and practical experience. In order to prepare you to undertake the project/thesis, course work in biostatistics, information technology, research methodology and project preparation guidance are provided. You will be made aware of best practices and the legislative framework relating to all aspects of food production, processing, marketing, business and distribution.

Master's thesis project

The Master's thesisÂ project will be organised during the second year. You will be involved inÂ selecting your projectÂ based on your choiceÂ of optional modules and career aspirations. Option to undertake aÂ summerÂ professional competency module in a company setting will additionally contribute to the development of the professional skills and experience.

Individual modules

Qualified candidates may study individual modules and accumulate credits over a timeframe planned together with the Programme Director and approved by the Joint Management Board . Individual modules may be taken as part of an approved industrial Continuous Professional Programme (CPD).

Structure The programme will be offered in a full-time format over two academic years. Studying individual modules may be possible as well. https://iiw.kuleuven.be/english/food4s/structure https://iiw.kuleuven.be/++resource++plone-logo.svg

Structure

The programme will be offered in a full-time format over two academic years. Studying individual modules may be possible as well.

Full-time format

The programme is offered in modules based on lectures, tutorials, workshops, seminars, site visits and student-directed learning. Each of the taught modules (core and optional) is offered over a two-Â three- to four-week timeframe with assessment scheduled on the completion of each module.

Subjects are developed to master level and reinforce the capacity to survey, critically evaluate and interpret the scientific literature, integrate basic and applied science and encourage the expression of independent opinion and critique in course assignments.

Seminars

In theÂ seminars , advanced-level and professionally relevant topics are debated based on academic and practical experience. In order to prepare you to undertake the project/thesis, course work in biostatistics, information technology, research methodology and project preparation guidance are provided. You will be made aware of best practices and the legislative framework relating to all aspects of food production, processing, marketing, business and distribution.

Master's thesis project

The Master's thesisÂ project will be organised during the second year. You will be involved inÂ selecting your projectÂ based on your choiceÂ of optional modules and career aspirations. Option to undertake aÂ summerÂ professional competency module in a company setting will additionally contribute to the development of the professional skills and experience.

Individual modules

Qualified candidates may study individual modules and accumulate credits over a timeframe planned together with the Programme Director and approved by the Joint Management Board . Individual modules may be taken as part of an approved industrial Continuous Professional Programme (CPD).

European Master of Science in Food Science, Technology and Nutrition

The Master of Science in Food Science, Technology and Nutrition (SefoTech.Nut) has operated for 12 years between 2005 and 2016.Â  From academic year 2015/2016 a new name has been applied, Master of Science in Food Science, Technology and Business (BiFTec) . Following, to address modern and currently emerging food safety and environmental issues, the programme has further evolved and as from 2020/2021 is entitled Master of Science in Sustainable Food SystemsÂ Engineering, Technology and Business (BiFTec-FOOD4S) .

Below information provides details onÂ the phased out programme Sefotech.Nut for informative purposes only. This programme is no longer in the offer as described here. For information on currently ongoing follow up of the Sefotech.Nut programme please visit this website .

Aim of the programme

To foster and develop knowledge and awareness of scientific trends and health issues in food science, technology and nutrition in a global context. In addition, the course seeks to enhance student's professional competence in areas such as safety, management and ethics.

Structure of the programme

  • Full time format
  • Individual modules
  • Timetable of the curriculum

Course scheme

The Master's programme is organised in a modular format and consists of:

  • six compulsory core modules
  • â four optional modules
  • the professional competence semesterÂ andÂ the Master's thesis

Career prospects

The Sefotech.nut general course aims are targeting on preparing competent academics for the sector of food production and processing and the herewith linked service sectors .

Approximately 90% of the graduates are getting full employment resulting from an ample number of job applications and within a reasonable application time of six months.Â The academic level of the Masterâs course is being proved by the ability of approximately 10% of graduates who continue their studies at third level making a PhD.

Alumni

Sefotech.Nut programme alumni over 2006 - 2018

Admission requirements

  • Bachelor's degree (B.Sc., B.Tech., B.Eng., etc.) or a degree at the level of a Bachelor's degree in relevant subjects such as Chemistry, Biological Sciences, Food Science and Technology, Nutrition or Engineering or cognate subject area.
  • Internationally recognized English language certificate (e.g. TOEFL 550/213/79 or IELTS score 6.5) is obligatory.

A joint degree

The joint degree has been granted EU support under the Erasmus Mundus programme since 2005 till 2016.

The Consortium of the four European partner universities jointly have committed themselves to each offering part of the curriculum.

  • KU Leuven, Technology Campus Ghent (former KaHo Sint-Lieven, Gent)
  • Dublin Institute of Technology
  • Hochschule Anhalt
  • Universidade CatÃ³lica Portuguesa, Porto

Professional Competence semester and Master's thesis

Semester three consists of a Professional Competence Module , organised by partner instititution(s) in cooperation with companies and/or research laboratories, as well as in associated partners, in a selected field:

  • Fermentation Technology
  • Meat Technology
  • Wine Making
  • New Trends in Food Processing
  • Food Business

The objective of the professional competence semester is to allow you to focus on a specialist area in which you wish to evelop your knowledge base, competance and skillset relevant to the food sector and thereby enhance your employment prospects. This semester should reassure students regarding choice of topic for the Master's thesis.

The Master's thesis will develop your understanding of the principles and practice of science even more. It should also assist you in developing an open-minded and confident approach to scientific problem-solving and enable you to acquire skills to contribute to research and development in food science, technology and business. You undertake the Master's thesis at one of the partner institutes, one of the associate institutes or at a collaborating academic centre of excellence.

OPTIONS IN THE PARTNER INSTITUTIONS

Several options and information about the professional competence module and the thesis project are available on the following powerpoint presentations:

  • Anhalt
  • Gent
  • Porto

Cooperation in education

Cooperation opportunities in education

Entrepreneurs and companies are our 'natural' partners in the education and lifelong learning of our engineers.

Not only do we have a lot to offer each other, we also need each other. By cooperating , we are able to train engineers who will meet expectations even better.

You do not have to look any further. In every Flemish province, there is a campus that is part of our multicampus faculty. Below, you will find a wide range of opportunities for constructive cooperation.

Research in Engineering Technology

Researchers at the Faculty of Engineering Technology belong to one of the research departments within the Science, EngineeringÂ & Technology Group.

The research ranges from demand-driven fundamental research to applied research and valorisation . We always keep social needs in mind and try to contribute to further industrial development in Flanders, Belgium and Europe with special attention for SMEs.

Due to the spread of our faculty researchers on the various campuses in Flanders, they have both strong local and international ties and a large network of companies and businesses . Thorough knowledge and expertise can be built up, exchanged and further developed. Our researchers have practical experience in implementing knowledge and technology in various companies or in spin-offs.

European Master of Science in Sustainable Food Systems Engineering, Technology and Business

BiFTec-FOOD4S

European Master of Sustainable Food Systems Engineering, Technology and Business https://iiw.kuleuven.be/english/food4s https://iiw.kuleuven.be/++resource++plone-logo.svg

Aim of the programme

Looking for a Master's programme to foster innovation and technology in order to cope with the future needs and sustainability in food systems, technology and business? You are welcome to join our European MSc programme!

To foster innovation and technology to cope with future needs and sustainability within our FOOD4S ( "food force" ) paradigm: S ustainable Food S ystem S S cience and Engineering.

BiFTec-FOOD4S adopts a transversal and multidisciplinary approach to a broad range of topics related to the 4S pillars Science (Food Science & Engineering Technology), Sustainability (Sustainable Food Product & Food Process Design), Safety (Food Safety & Quality), and Simulation (Computational Food Science & Technology).

A joint degree

The Consortium of the four European partner universities jointly have committed themselves to each offering part of the curriculum. Successful graduates are awarded a joint degree.

KU Leuven,Â Ghent Technology Campus

Universidade CatÃ³lica Portuguesa, Porto

AnhaltÂ University of Applied Sciences

University College Dublin

Admission requirements and application

Admission requirements

  • More information on admission requirements

Application

To apply nowÂ for the BiFTec-FOOD4S programme in the Application Tool please select:

  • Type of programme: Master's programme in English (diploma contract)
  • Academic year: 2025-2026
  • Programme: European Master in Sustainable Food Systems Engineering, Technology and Business (Ghent et al)

Application form

Apply now for the European Master in Sustainable Food Systems Engineering, Technology and Business (BiFTec-FOOD4S) !

Application deadlines

  • 1 st of March: AllÂ nationals applyingÂ for admission and consortium scholarship *
  • 1 st of June:Â all nationals on self-paying basis (admission only)

    * Your application is automatically considered for the consortium scholarship if application and all required supporting documents have been uploaded by the deadline of 1st of March

Associated partners

AdditionalÂ to the four European consortium partners, the study programme also benefits from the involvement of associated partners, who contribute through knowledge and skills transfer, the provisions and backing possibilities for (optional) professional competence module and/or Master's thesis.

The associated partners include:

  • French National Research Institute for Agriculture,Â FoodÂ and Environment - INRAE, France
  • University ofÂ Tasmania, Australia
  • University of Campinas UNICAMP, Brazil
  • Nofima -Â food research institute in fisheries and aquaculture, Norway
  • Queen's University of Belfast, UK
  • CLUN, United Dairy Cooperatives, Spain
  • University of Zagreb, Croatia

Structure

As of 2020-2021 the Master's programme consists of 90 ECTS taught modules and 30 ECTS Master's thesis project. Summer Professional Competence module is optional.

The Master's programmeÂ is organised in a modular format:

  • Full-time format
  • Individual modules
  • Timetable of the curriculum

Career prospects

The European Master of Science in Sustainable Food Systems Engineering, Technology and Business (BiFTec-FOOD4S) general course aims are targeting on preparing competent employees for sectors including sustainable food production, processing and agribusiness, in industry, academia and government.

Approximately 90% of the graduates of the precedingÂ SEFOTECH.NUT course run from 2006 till 2016 and BiFTeC course (2015-2020) are getting full employment resulting from an ample number of job applications and within a reasonable application time of six months.Â The academic level of the Masterâs course is being proved by the ability of approximately 10% of graduates who continue their studies at third level making a PhD.

Information relating to individuals (personal data) is collected and used in accordance with the Regulation (EC) No 45/2001 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 18 December 2000 on the protection of individuals with regard to the processing of personal data by the Community institutions and bodies and on the free movement of such data, OJ L8 of 12.1.2001, p. 1.

The development of a joint curriculum for BIFTEC-FOOD4S programme took place during implementation of the previous projects: European Master of Food Science, Technology and Nutrition (SEFOTECH.NUT)
and European Master of Food Science, Technology and Business (BiFTec) run under Erasmus Mundus framework:Â 2005-2011, 2010-2016, and 2015-2020.
